intro: Meliosma angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf meliosma, is a deciduous shrub native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Rhoipteleaceae and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy beneath. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters during the spring, followed by elliptical, woody fruits. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in forest understories. Its foliage provides habitat for various insects and contributes to the biodiversity of its ecosystem.
